Article Title: Google announces Pixel Studio AI image-generating app, rivals Apple's Image Playground app
Article Text:
Pixel Studio app to come pre-installed on Pixel 9 series

Google unveiled its Pixel 9 series at its Made by Google event. The series comprises four phones – Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro, Pixel 9 Pro XL and Pixel 9 Pro Fold. At the event, the company also announced a new image generation app called Pixel Studio.“Pixel Studio is a first-of-its-kind image generator. So now you can bring all ideas to life from scratch, right on your phone — a true creative canvas,” the company said in a blog post announcing the new app.Pixel Studio app rivals Apple’s forthcoming Image Playground app as part of Apple Intelligence features with the iOS18 rollout.The new image editor app uses Google’s Imagen 3 model and has the ability to transform text-based prompts into images. The app also offers on-device AI edition tools including erasing objects from the frame or repositioning an object.As announced by Google, the Pixel Studio app will come preinstalled on the Pixel 9 devices.The app will also suggest art styles, such as cinematic and anime, depending on the prompt.“It’s powered by combining an on-device diffusion model running on Tensor G4 and our Imagen 3 text-to-image model in the cloud. With a UI optimized for easy prompting, style changes and editing, you can quickly bring your ideas to conversations with friends and family,” Google said in the blog post.
Article Summary: Google unveiled its Pixel 9 series at its Made by Google event. At the event, the company also announced a new image generation app called Pixel Studio. The new image editor app uses Google’s Imagen 3 model and has the ability to transform text-based prompts into images. Pixel Studio app will come preinstalled on the Pixel 9 devices.

Article Title: FBI shuts down ‘dangerous’ global hacking group that targeted over 40 companies in 13 countries, including India
Article Text:
How Radar group attacked unsuspecting victims

The Federal Bureau of Investigation ( FBI ) has taken down the globally active hacking group Radar/Dispossessor . The operation involved taking down servers across the US, UK, and Germany, disrupting the group's ability to launch attacks. The criminal ransomware group reportedly targeted 43 companies, including in India, in sectors such as healthcare and transport.“Since its inception in August 2023, Radar/Dispossessor has quickly developed into an internationally impactful ransomware group, targeting and attacking small-to-mid-sized businesses and organisations from the production, development, education, healthcare, financial services, and transportation sectors,” the FBI said.“Originally focused on entities in the US, the investigation discovered 43 companies as victims of the attacks, from countries including Argentina, Australia, Belgium, Brazil, Honduras, India, Canada, Croatia, Peru, Poland, the United Kingdom, the United Arab Emirates, and Germany,” the agency added.Dispossessor group’s activities are said to be similar to LockBit, which provided ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) and was taken down earlier this year. The group was led by the online moniker “Brain” and targeted small to medium-sized companies.The hacking group employed aggressive tactics, including doxxing (digital stalking) victims, leaking stolen data and threatening to expose illegal activities. The ransomware gang's modus operandi involved stealing data before encrypting systems, increasing pressure on victims to pay the ransom.The group also leveraged compromised systems, weak passwords and lack of two-factor authentication to gain initial access to target networks. Once in a company’s IT systems where data is stored, the group would encrypt it and then hold it for ransom.“Once the company was attacked, if they did not contact the criminal actor, the group would then proactively contact others in the victim company, either through email or phone call. The emails also included links to video platforms on which the previously stolen files had been presented. This was always with the aim of increasing the blackmail pressure and increasing the willingness to pay,” the FBI said.Finally, the compromise is then announced by the attackers on a separate leak page and a countdown set until public release of the victim data if no ransom was paid, the FBI added.
Article Summary: Radar/Dispossessor targeted 43 companies, including in India, in sectors such as healthcare and transport. Group's modus operandi involved stealing data before encrypting systems, increasing pressure on victims to pay the ransom. Operation involved taking down servers across the US, UK, and Germany, disrupting the group's ability to launch attacks.

Article Title: Everything announced at Google's 'Made by Google' hardware showcase: Three new Pixel 9 phones, a new Pixel Fold, two Pixel Watches and more
Article Text:
Pixel 9 lineup: Three's company, four's a party





112505078



Pixel 9 Pro Fold: Thinner, taller, and more refined

AI galore

Gemini Live: Your AI assistant gets chatty







Pixel Watch 3: Big and small, smart and fit

Pixel Buds Pro 2: Time for round two

Even though Google was two months early of its usual schedule, it came in with the full bang at its hardware reveal. From Gemini taking centre stage to a slew of new hardware, Google pulled out all the stops at its “Made by Google” showcase. We saw not one, not two, but four new Pixel phones, including a second-gen foldable that has a weird name. And did I mention AI ? It's everywhere, folks.Let's dive into this Pixel wonderland and break down all the details.Google's bringing not one, not two, but three new slab phones to the Pixel party. Four, if we count in the foldable, but let’s save it for later. First up, we've got the base Pixel 9 with a 6.3-inch display, then there’s the Pixel 9 Pro sporting the same 6.3-inch screen. And for those who like 'em big, the Pixel 9 Pro XL is here with a bigger 6.8-inch display.All three phones are rocking a fancy new oval-shaped camera housing that's sure to turn heads – with the base Pixel 9 having a 50MP main and a 48 mp ultrawide; the Pros add on a third 48MP telephoto that can do up to 5x zoom. The sides are flat on all the phones; matt on the vanilla ones, while the Pros have a glossy finish.Under the hood, you'll find Google's updated G4 Tensor chip, promising better battery life and more AI tricks up its sleeve. Oh, and did I mention satellite SOS? Yeah, they've got that too. The new phones come with the usual 7-year promise OS and security updates. Though, these phones run Android 17The Pixel 9 starts at Rs 79,900,. The Pixel 9 Pro will set you back Rs 1,09,999, while the Pro XL starts at a cool Rs 1,24,999. Mark your calendars: the Pixel 9 and 9 Pro XL hit the shelves on August 22nd, with the smaller Pixel 9 Pro following in September.But wait, there's more! Google's not done with foldables, oh no. Enter the Pixel 9 Pro Fold, the sleeker cousin of last year's Pixel Fold . The second iteration is taller and thinner than its predecessor, measuring a svelte 5.1mm when unfolded.The Pixel 9 Pro Fold is packing some serious screen real estate. We're talking a 6.3-inch outer display and a 8-inch inner screen. And get this: that inner display can hit 2,700 nits of brightness. Sunlight? What sunlight?Powered by the same G4 Tensor chip as its slab siblings, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold is ready to fold its way into your heart (and wallet) for Rs 1,72,999. It should come to India sometime next month, so you have time to ready your financesIt’s no secret that Google's going all-in on AI with its new Pixel lineup. Gemini, Google's AI assistant, is front and centre, ready to dig through your apps or answer questions about that selfie you just took.Google's serving up two new AI-powered features with the Pixel 9 family. First, there's Pixel Screenshots, which uses on-device AI to let you search through your saved screenshots like a digital detective. Then we've got Pixel Studio , a text-to-image generator that'll have you creating masterpieces with a few taps.And let's not forget about those AI-powered camera tricks. "Add Me" lets you photobomb group shots after the fact by stitching two scenes together. Magic Editor in Google Photos is getting an upgrade too, letting you replace entire sections of a photo with AI-generated content. Sky's the limit? Not anymore!As Gemini becomes default on Pixel 9 phones, Google's giving Gemini a voice with Gemini Live. This new voice chat option lets you have a full-on conversation with Google's AI assistant. Choose from 10 different voices and chat away like you're talking to a futuristic friend. You can even interrupt mid-sentence, just like in real life!The Pixel Watch 3 is here, and it's bringing a friend. Alongside the familiar 41mm size, we've got a new 45mm option for those who like their smartwatches like they like their coffee – grande.Both sizes are sporting thinner bezels for more screen real estate, a brighter display hitting 2,000 nits, and a fancy new ultra wideband chip. But the real showstopper? Loss of Pulse Detection. This feature can detect if your pulse stops and call emergency services if you don't respond.The 41mm Pixel Watch 3 starts at Rs 39,999, while the 45mm version will set you back Rs 42,999. Both hit the stores later this year.Last but not least, we've got the Pixel Buds Pro 2. These little audio wonders are smaller, lighter, and packing more punch than ever. With 11-millimetre drivers and a new Tensor A1 chip, they're promising better sound and improved active noise cancellation.Google's added a wing fin design to keep these buds snug during your workouts, and you'll get up to 8 hours of playback with ANC on (or a marathon 30 hours with the case). At Rs 22,900, they're a bit pricier than last year's model. These are also slated to drop sometime later this year.And there you have it, folks! Google's Pixel-palooza was a whirlwind of new hardware, AI features, and enough tech to make even the most jaded gadget lover's head spin. From foldable phones to AI-powered photography, Google's throwing down the gauntlet for the rest of the tech world. The future of Google’s hardware is looking bright, Pixel-y, and very, very smart.
Article Summary: Google unveiled four new Pixel phones, including a second-gen foldable. The new phones come with the usual 7-year promise OS and security updates. Gemini, Google's AI assistant, is front and centre, ready to dig through your apps or answer questions about that selfie you just took.

Article Title: Google's new Pixel Screenshots uses AI to find anything and everything from your messy screenshot collection
Article Text: Google 's latest Pixel 9 smartphones come with a clever new trick: an AI assistant that can sift through your messy collection of screenshots and pull out the information you need.The new Pixel Screenshots app oughts to solve the common problem of taking countless screenshots but struggling to find them later. Using on-device artificial intelligence powered by Google's Gemini Nano technology , the app analyses and organises screenshots as users capture them."We've all been there - you know you saved that restaurant's address or your friend's Wi-Fi password somewhere, but scrolling through hundreds of images is a nightmare," said Sarah Chen, Google's VP of Pixel Software. "Pixel Screenshots does the searching for you."Users can simply ask questions like "What was Sam's Wi-Fi password?" or "When does that concert go on sale?" The app will then scan through saved screenshots, extract the relevant information, and provide an answer along with the source image.The feature works entirely on the device, addressing potential privacy concerns about sending sensitive data to the cloud. It's powered by Google's new Tensor G4 chip, which enables advanced on-device AI processing.Pixel Screenshots also allows users to import older screenshots, making years of captured information searchable. The app automatically generates titles and summaries for each image, making browsing easier.The feature is currently exclusive to the Pixel 9 series, though Google hasn't ruled out bringing it to older models in the future.
Article Summary: Pixel Screenshots app analyses and organises screenshots as users capture them. Users can simply ask questions like "What was Sam's Wi-Fi password?" or "When does that concert go on sale?" The app will then scan through saved screenshots, extract the relevant information, and provide an answer.

Google has launched the Pixel 9 series in India, featuring the Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro, Pixel 9 Pro XL and Pixel 9 Pro Fold, all packed with advanced AI features for productivity and photography. These are the first Pixel phones to run the Gemini Nano multimodal AI model on-device. However, Google has shared the pre-order and sale details of only the Pixel 9 and Pixel 9 Pro XL models.Apart from the Pixel 9 series, the company has also announced the Pixel Buds Pro 2 earbuds and the Pixel Watch 3 in two sizes for India.While Google has announced the price of the Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro Fold in India, the availability details for these models remain undisclosed. Meanwhile, the Pixel 9 and Pixel 9 Pro XL are confirmed to start shipping on August 22. Google has confirmed that details about the Pixel 9 Pro's pre-orders and availability will be shared later this year.Customers can pre-order only the Pixel 9 and Pixel 9 Pro XL models on Flipkart starting August 14. Users can find Pixel products even at Croma and Reliance Retail outlets across the country as Google makes them available for purchase, starting with Pixel 9 and Pixel 9 Pro XL. The company will also bring its family of Pixel devices to offline locations and will be present in about 150 Croma and Reliance Retail stores in over 15 cities across India.The Pixel 9 is available in Obsidian, Porcelain, Wintergreen, and Peony, while the Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL will come in Obsidian, Porcelain, Hazel, and Rose Quartz.The Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro, Pixel 9 Pro XL and Pixel 9 Pro Fold are priced at Rs 79,999, Rs 1,09,999, Rs 1,24,999 and Rs 1,72,999, respectively.Apart from these phones, Google has also announced the India prices of the Pixel Buds Pro 2 and the Pixel Watch 3. The Pixel Buds Pro 2 is priced at Rs 22,900 in India while the 41mm and the new 45mm models of the Pixel Watch 3 carry price tags of Rs 39,990 and Rs 43,990, respectively.It's important to note that only the Wi-Fi versions of the Pixel Watch 3 will be available in India. Google hasn’t shared any pre-order or sale details of these products as well.The launch offers for these Pixel phones include:
Article Summary: Google has launched the Pixel 9 series of smartphones in India. The Pixel 9 is the first phone to run the Gemini Nano multimodal AI model on-device. Google has also announced the prices of the Pixel Buds Pro 2 earbuds and the Pixel Watch 3.

Article Title: Independence Day 2024: Where and how to watch PM Narendra Modi’s August 15 speech live
Article Text:
Independence Day 2024 parade live: When and where to watch

Television broadcast: The event will be aired live on Doordarshan, India's public service broadcaster, which has been the traditional channel for covering national events.

Live streaming: For those who prefer to watch the event online, the live broadcast will be available on the Press Information Bureau (PIB) YouTube channel. Additionally, the event will be streamed on social media platforms including X (formerly Twitter), where the official handles @PIB_India and @PMOIndia will provide real-time updates and live coverage.

Independence Day 2024 theme: "Viksit Bharat"

Focus areas: The theme of "Viksit Bharat" emphasises comprehensive growth across various sectors, including education, healthcare, infrastructure, and technology. The objective is to enhance India's global standing through sustained economic growth, social progress, and sustainable development.

Prime Minister’s speech: During his speech, Prime Minister Modi is expected to reflect on the nation's achievements over the past year, outline future goals, and discuss key policies aimed at realising the vision of a developed India. The address will also pay homage to the freedom fighters who laid down their lives for the nation's independence.

Independence Day 2024 parade and evening celebrations

India’s military prowess: The parade will feature displays of advanced military equipment and the disciplined march of the armed forces, reflecting the strength and readiness of the nation’s defence capabilities.

Cultural diversity: India’s rich cultural heritage will be on full display, with colourful performances and tableaux representing various states and regions.

Technological progress: The parade will also highlight India's advancements in technology, with exhibits demonstrating the country’s progress in fields such as space exploration, digital innovation, and sustainable energy.

Har Ghar Tiranga campaign

"Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam" campaign

Launch and objectives: This campaign was officially launched by Prime Minister Modi on World Environment Day, June 5, 2024. The goal is to plant 1.5 million trees across India, symbolising a commitment to environmental sustainability and honouring the earth as a nurturing mother.

Participants: The tree-planting initiative will involve various defence-related organisations, including the three armed services, Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO), defence Public Sector Undertakings (PSUs), Controller General of Defence Accounts (CGDA), National Cadet Corps (NCC), Sainik Schools, and ordnance factories. This wide participation underscores the collective effort towards environmental conservation.

Also read

India is set to celebrate its 78th Independence Day on August 15, 2024. The day will be marked by a series of patriotic events, with the highlight being Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s address to the nation from the historic Red Fort in New Delhi. This will be PM Modi's 11th consecutive Independence Day speech, an event anticipated by millions across the country.Here’s everything you need to know about when and where to watch this momentous occasion live, along with details on the theme and related campaigns.The official Independence Day ceremony will commence early in the morning, with Prime Minister Modi expected to hoist the national flag at 7:30 AM. The event will be broadcast live, ensuring that citizens across the country and the world can witness this significant occasion.This year’s Independence Day carries the theme "Viksit Bharat," which translates to "Developed India." The theme underscores the Indian government’s ambitious vision of transforming India into a fully developed nation by 2047, the centenary of its independence.Following the Prime Minister's speech, the Independence Day celebrations will continue with a grand parade. This parade is a major highlight of the day, showcasing:In the evening, major buildings and monuments across the country will be illuminated in the tricolour, adding to the festive atmosphere. The sight of these illuminated structures, from Rashtrapati Bhavan to the Gateway of India, symbolises national pride and unity.Running parallel to the Independence Day celebrations is the "Har Ghar Tiranga" campaign, which takes place from August 9 to August 15, 2024. The initiative, spearheaded by the Indian government, encourages every citizen to hoist the national flag at their homes.The campaign aims to instil a deep sense of patriotism and national pride among citizens. By participating, individuals not only express their love for the nation but also contribute to a larger narrative of unity and national identity.Union Minister of Culture and Tourism, Gajendra Singh Shekhawat, emphasised the campaign's importance, stating, “The initiative aims to instil a spirit of patriotism and national pride among citizens by encouraging every Indian to hoist the national flag.”In conjunction with the Independence Day festivities, the Ministry of Defence has launched the "Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam" campaign, a nationwide tree-planting drive.
Article Summary: India is set to celebrate its 78th Independence Day on August 15, 2024. The event will be broadcast live on Doordarshan, India's public service broadcaster. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to give his 11th consecutive Independence Day speech from the historic Red Fort in New Delhi.

Article Title: Tech layoffs cross 100,000 in July 2024: Intel, Microsoft, Dyson, UKG and these companies cut thousands jobs
Article Text:
Intel mass layoffs, over 15,000 employees to let go

Microsoft lays off over 1,000 staff in last two month

Software giant UKG cuts 2,200 jobs

Intuit lets go of 1,800 employees

Dyson cuts 1,000 jobs at its headquarters

Kaspersky to lay off all its employees in the US as it exits the country after ban

Bengaluru startup ReshaMandi lays off 80% of staff

Koo shut downs operations, all the employees laid off

Unacademy restructures, cuts 250 jobs

WayCool slashes workforce by 200 employees amid funding struggles



PocketFM fires 200 writers for its internet FM show

Sony-owned Bungie cuts 220 staff, reassigning 155 others

Humble Games lays off entire staff as it fails to find a buyer

The wave of tech industry layoffs persisted through July 2024, with over 8,000 professionals across 34 technology companies lost their jobs this month. The total layoff count for 2024 has now reached 124,517 employees from 384 companies worldwide.Intel is laying off over 15,000 employees, representing more than 15% of its workforce, as part of a $10 billion cost-saving initiative for 2025.CEO Pat Gelsinger cited lower-than-expected revenue growth and challenges in capitalising on AI trends as reasons for the measures. The company plans to complete the majority of layoffs by the end of 2024 and will offer voluntary retirement and departure options to eligible employees.In June, Microsoft laid off around 1,000 employees across Mixed Reality and Azure 'moonshots' departments. A month later, in July, several employees took to social media after they were let go. While Microsoft didn't confirm the latest round of job cuts , those affected say that the trimming down affected roles related to product and product management. However, no number has been disclosed.Massachusetts-based software company UKG initiated the month's largest layoffs, cutting 14% of its workforce—approximately 2,200 employees. The company, which previously employed 15,882 people, cited a need to focus on critical growth areas to support its long-term strategy.California-based financial management software firm Intuit announced plans to eliminate 1,800 jobs, representing about 10% of its staff. The company says that it plans to refill these positions, in the product and other customer-facing roles.Dyson, the British appliance manufacturer, announced plans to cut approximately 1,000 jobs in the UK, affecting more than a quarter of its local workforce. CEO Hanno Kirner cited fierce competition and rapid innovation as reasons for the restructuring. The company, which employs around 15,000 people globally, has promised support for affected employees but did not specify the total number of worldwide job cuts, as reviews are being conducted on a country-by-country basis.Russian cybersecurity firm Kaspersky announced it will cease operations in the United States and lay off dozens of employees following a U.S. government ban on its software. The ban, set to take effect on July 20, 2024, cites security risks due to the company's Russian headquarters. The company, which initially planned to challenge the ban, now acknowledges its U.S. business is "no longer viable" and will "gradually wind down" operations, affecting less than 50 employees in the country.ReshaMandi, a Bengaluru-based startup specializing in silk yarn products, has laid off 80% of its workforce after failing to secure Series B funding. The startup’s employee count dropped from 500 in January 2023 to around 100 by year-end, with reports suggesting that 300 former employees are still awaiting final dues and salaries.Indian microblogging platform Koo, once seen as a potential rival to X (formerly Twitter), closed its doors after acquisition talks with Dailyhunt fell through. The company reportedly employed around 200 staff as of September 2021.Indian edtech giant Unacademy announced layoffs affecting approximately 250 employees. The restructuring impacted 100 staff in marketing, business, and product roles, along with 150 in sales positions.Chennai-based agritech firm WayCool laid off over 200 employees in its third round of job cuts within a 12-month period. The company cited streamlining efforts to prevent losses as it grappled with funding challenges.Bengaluru-based audio series platform PocketFM reportedly laid off close to 200 writers, primarily affecting its US-based audio series team. The exact number of affected employees remains unclear.Bungie, the game development studio owned by Sony, has announced a significant round of layoffs, cutting 220 jobs (17% of its workforce) due to rising development costs and economic pressures. This follows a previous round of 100 layoffs in October 2023, bringing the total workforce reduction to about 40% over the past year. CEO Pete Parsons cited overly ambitious growth and financial strain as reasons for the cuts. Alongside the layoffs, Bungie is working with Sony Interactive Entertainment to reassign 155 employees to other departments within SIE. Despite these changes, Bungie plans to maintain focus on its core projects, Destiny 2 and Marathon, with over 850 team members still dedicated to these games.Indie publisher Humble Games, a subsidiary of Ziff Davis, has laid off its entire team of 36 employees. The company, which has published nearly 50 indie games, initially faced rumours of closure but later clarified it would continue operations. Internal documents reveal that Ziff Davis attempted to sell Humble Games twice in recent years without success.
Article Summary: Intel is laying off over 15,000 employees, representing more than 15% of its workforce, as part of a $10 billion cost-saving initiative for 2025. Software giant UKG initiated the month's largest layoffs, cutting 2,200 employees. Dyson, the British appliance manufacturer, announced plans to cut approximately 1,000 jobs in the UK. Indian microblogging platform Koo, once seen as a potential rival to X (formerly Twitter), closed its doors after acquisition talks with Dailyhunt fell through.

Article Title: Reliance Jio, Airtel and Vodafone-Idea 'unhappy' with Trai's new QoS rules; say overlook ground realities
Article Text:
COAI statement

COAI’s member Telecom Service Providers (TSPs) have consistently invested in enhancing Quality of Service (QoS) through significant improvements in network infrastructure, resulting in greater stability and reliability. The industry has embraced advanced technologies and automation tools, including predictive maintenance and AI-driven analytics, to proactively address network issues. Moreover, major initiatives are underway to fiberize towers across India, which is a crucial step for the efficient deployment of 5G services.

While TRAI has tightened the QoS benchmarks over the years, the ground realities remain unchanged. TSPs still grapple with Right of Way (RoW) issues when acquiring permissions for infrastructure deployment in public and private land for the installation of cell towers and fiber-optic cables. The situation is further aggravated due to additional requirement of street furniture for the 5G networks. Moreover, interference from various sources, such as other wireless devices and electromagnetic interference, degrade signal quality and network performance. Further, illegal boosters and repeaters used by unauthorised agents, as well as the cases of theft of equipment are also external factors which, nevertheless, impact the QoS. Besides, frequent takedown of the overhead fiber by the authorities have a significant impact in QoS as well. TSPs have limited control over these external sources which adversely impact the Quality of Services.

Despite these challenges, TSPs have consistently met TRAI's QoS benchmarks. The industry expresses concern over the proposed regulations, which not only tighten benchmarks but also shift from quarterly to monthly reporting and site to cell level reporting in many cases. In fact, the QoS parameters prescribed in the new Regulations have not been introduced by any other regulator in other similar economies. These changes are expected to significantly increase the compliance as well as the cost burden on telecom operators, and without commensurate benefits for the customers.

While we are disappointed with the stringency of these new regulations, we remain committed to engaging constructively with TRAI on QoS-related matters. Our member organizations will continue to strive for excellence in service quality while advocating for regulations that recognize the practical challenges faced by our industry.

What are the new QoS rules

The telecom industry has raised concerns over stringent new quality of service (QoS) norms introduced by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India ( TRAI ). The Cellular Operators Association of India (COAI), representing major telecom players -- Reliance Jio , Airtel and Vodafone-Idea -- argues that the regulations impose excessive burdens without addressing the challenges operators face on the ground.The new rules mandate stricter service quality benchmarks, increased penalties for non-compliance, and more frequent reporting requirements. Telecom operators must now compensate subscribers for outages exceeding 24 hours at the district level and face penalties of up to Rs 10 lakh for violations.However, COAI contends that these measures are impractical given ongoing hurdles such as right-of-way (RoW) issues for infrastructure deployment, interference from unauthorized devices, and theft of equipment. The industry body also highlights the impact of frequent fiber cuts and the additional demands of 5G network rollout. Despite these challenges, telecom operators have consistently met Trai's QoS benchmarks , according to COAI. The industry is seeking a more realistic approach that acknowledges the operational difficulties and avoids placing undue financial pressure on operators.Trai has issued new quality of service (QoS) rules, making it mandatory for telecom operators to compensate subscribers in case of service outages for more than 24 hours at a district level. Trai has also increased the penal amount to Rs 1 lakh from Rs 50,000 for failing to meet each quality benchmark under the new rules.The telecom regulator has introduced a graded penalty system of Rs 1 lakh, Rs 2 lakh, Rs 5 lakh and Rs 10 lakh for different scales of rule violations and submitting false report under revised regulations -- "The Standards of Quality of Service of Access (Wirelines and Wireless) and Broadband (Wireline and Wireless) Service Regulations, 2024".Trai has provided a six-month grace period for operators to align their systems with the new regulations.
Article Summary: The Cellular Operators Association of India (COAI), representing major telecom players -- Reliance Jio, Airtel and Vodafone-Idea -- argues that the regulations impose excessive burdens. The industry body also highlights the impact of frequent fiber cuts and the additional demands of 5G network rollout.

Article Title: Google launches Pixel 9 Pro Fold, it’s first-ever foldable phone in India
Article Text:
Pixel 9 Pro Fold has bigger and brighter displays

Tensor G4, Gemini and more AI inside

Upgraded cameras with the new 'Add me' AI feature for photos

Google has launched its second-generation Pixel foldable phone, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold , which is its first-ever foldable phone in India. The second-gen Pixel Fold upgrades on some salient aspects over the first one. Per Google, the foldable is slim, super durable, and has a brighter screen, both on the outside and inside. And, the phone also packs in Pixel’s “fastest, most powerful” Tensor G4 chip , bringing on-device multimodal capabilities to the phone.On the inside, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold has an 8 inches ‘Super Actua Flex display,’ an LTPO panel with a 2922x1344 resolution at 486 PPI. The inner screen has a dynamic refresh rate of 1-120Hz and can go as bright as 3,000 nits, which Google says is 80% brighter than the screen on the first-gen Pixel Fold. To make use of phone’s large inner canvas, there’s a split-screen mode that’ll let you use two apps side-by-side.When unfolded, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold can be used a regular phone with a 6.3 inches outer screen, which has the same specs as the inner screen.Google says that the Pixel 9 Pro Fold has an “all-new” hinge that is made from stainless steel and has an aerospace grade aluminium alloy cover. The hinge has a polished finish, while the back has the silky matt finish. The phone is rated IPX8 for water resistivity. And there’s Gorilla Glass Victus 2 on the outside.Powering the Pixel 9 Pro Fold is Google’s Tensor G4 chip, also found on the other three Pixel 9 phones. The chip comes paired with 16GB of RAM and up to 1TB storage. Then, there’s theTitan M2 security coprocessor , which enables multi-layer hardware security.There’s a 5,060mAh battery, which Google promises will last for over 24 hours and up to 100 hours with Extreme Battery Saver. The phone supports fast charging at 45W, which should fill up the battery up to 55% in about 30 minutes. FYI, the charger isn’t included in the box. The phone also supports Qi wireless charging and Battery Share, i.e., reverse wireless charging.Out-of-the-box the Pixel 9 Pro Fold will come with Android 14 . There’s the usual Google promise of 7 years of OS and security updates.Would it even be a Pixel phone, if there’s no AI in it. Well, there’s a whole lot of AI. For starters Gemini is there, and it works in split-screen mode, as well. One could ask Gemini to write stuff or even get info about whats’s on the screen or photos. Circle To Search is also there, ohh and this feature can help you check if an image has been created using AI.The new “Pixel-exclusive” AI feature to arrive is Pixel Screenshots. The feature could organise or recall things, like events and location, all you need to is ask the phone.Google is giving one year of the Google One AI Premium plan for free to those who’ll buy the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. So, that’ll give you access to Gemini Advanced, Gemini in Gmail and Docs, on top of 2TB of cloud storage.The Pixel 9 Pro Fold ditches the camera visor for a squircle module that houses a triple lens setup – a 50MP wide camera, a 48MP ultraide and a 48MP 5x telephoto camera. For selfies, there's a 42 MP front-facing camera on the inner screen and 10MP camera on the outside.The camera hardware has been only a part of Pixel’s camera, but it’s AI that completes it. There’s a long list of AI features that complements the camera hardware on the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. The usual Super Res Zoom, Zoom Enhance, Video Boost, Face Unblur, Photo Unblur, Best Take, Magic Eraser, Audio Eraser, and Magic Editor makes their return. Well, Magic Eraser now has an a “reimagine” feature that Google says can give photos a “whole new look.”One new AI tool to come to Google’s Pixel 9 pro Fold is the “Add Me,” which as you’d image can add you to a picture. So, how does it work? Well, you take photo with the group, swap in yourself, and AI will merge the photos.Google Pixel 9 Pro Fold is priced in India at Rs 1,72,999 and will be available for purchase later this year. While it comes in two colours – Obsidian and Porcelain – it’ll be available only in Obsidian colour in India.
Article Summary: Google has launched its second-generation Pixel foldable phone, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. The second-gen Pixel Fold upgrades on some salient aspects over the first one. Per Google, the foldable is slim, super durable, and has a brighter screen, both on the outside and inside. And, the phone also packs in Pixel’s “fastest, most powerful” Tensor G4 chip.

Article Title: CrowdStrike sued by fliers after Microsoft outage disrupted air travel, company responds
Article Text:
What CrowdStrike says

Delta Airlines seeks compensation for disruption

In mounting problems for CrowdStrike over Microsoft outage last month, the cybersecurity company being sued by air travellers in a latest move. According to a Reuters report, air travellers whose flights were delayed or cancelled on July 19 due to Microsoft Windows outage on July 19 have filed a class action against the company.The plaintiffs include three fliers who filed the lawsuit in the federal court, Austin, Texas.They blame CrowdStrike's negligence in testing and deploying its software for the outage. Adding further, they stated that as fliers scrambled to get to their destinations, many spent hundreds of dollars on lodging, meals and alternative travel, while others missed work or suffered health problems from having to sleep on the airport floor.The filers demand CrowdStrike to pay compensatory and punitive damages to anyone whose flight was disrupted.In a statement, CrowdStrike said "We believe this case lacks merit and we will vigorously defend the company." The US cybersecurity company also provided an identical statement in response to a shareholder lawsuit filed on July 31.Delta claims that it faced over 2,200 flight cancellations on July 19 alone, with more than 6,000 flights cancelled since then. The airline is now dealing with over 176,000 refund or reimbursement requests. The estimated cost of the outages could reach as high as $500 million.The company’s CEO Ed Bastian said last week the outage had cost the airline $500 million, adding that it plans to take legal action to get compensation from the cybersecurity firm.Microsoft outage on July 19 was caused by a faulty software update that impacted 8 million Windows computers worldwide. CrowdStrike has rejected Delta Airlines' claim stating that it is "highly disappointed by Delta's suggestion that CrowdStrike acted inappropriately and strongly rejects any allegation that it was grossly negligent or committed misconduct."
Article Summary: Air travellers whose flights were delayed or cancelled on July 19 have filed a class action against CrowdStrike. Plaintiffs include three fliers who filed the lawsuit in the federal court, Austin, Texas. They blame CrowdStrike's negligence in testing and deploying its software for the outage.

Article Title: Binance, the world's largest crypto exchange, gets Rs 722 crore GST from DGGI
Article Text: In a groundbreaking move, the Ahmedabad zonal unit of the Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) has issued a show cause notice to Binance , the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange , demanding Goods and Services Tax (GST) payment of Rs 722 crore. This marks the first time the DGGI has issued such a notice to a cryptocurrency firm, setting a significant precedent in India’s efforts to regulate the rapidly growing virtual currency market.Sources confirmed that the notice was issued to Binance for collecting fees from Indian customers trading in virtual digital assets (VDAs) on their platform, categorized under online information database access or retrieval (OIDAR) services.Earlier this year, Binance received approval from India’s Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) to register as a virtual asset service provider (VASP). However, the company was slapped with a Rs 18 crore penalty from the FIU last month for non-compliance with anti-money laundering (AML) regulations.Despite being a major player in the global cryptocurrency market, with at least 40% market share and operations across more than 150 countries, Binance had not registered under the Indian GST framework. This oversight has now brought the company under the scrutiny of Indian tax authorities.“Binance reportedly earned at least Rs 4,000 crore from transaction fees charged to Indian customers. The company has a user base of 90 million users globally, including a substantial number of customers from India too. Detailed investigation revealed that the earnings of these fees were credited to the account of a Binance Group Company — Nest Services Limited — based in Seychelles,” a top source privy to the development said.In fact, Binance is reportedly facing a trial in a Nigerian court for alleged tax evasion, following a crypto crackdown in the country.To make Binance compliant with the GST regulations, DGGI Ahmedabad zonal unit also sent emails to Binance group companies in Seychelles, the Cayman Islands and Switzerland, which did not elicit a response. Binance appointed a local counsel in India to liaise with the DGGI, marking the first step towards resolving this significant tax compliance issue.Sources confirmed that DGGI is also closely monitoring financial transactions and activities of online gaming platforms and marketplaces for the possibility of tax evasion.The Indian GST regime mandates that foreign service providers pay GST for services provided to Indian residents, particularly under the OIDAR category. As the investigation continues, other cryptocurrency exchanges operating both overseas and within India are also expected to face scrutiny from tax authorities, said sources.
Article Summary: The Ahmedabad zonal unit of the Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) has issued a show cause notice to Binance. This marks the first time the DGGI has issued such a notice to a cryptocurrency firm, setting a significant precedent in India’s efforts to regulate the rapidly growing virtual currency market.

Article Title: 'Flipkart Minutes' is here to take on Blinkit, Swiggy Instamart and BBNow; here’s the city its available in
Article Text: Flipkart, the Walmart-owned e-commerce giant, has launched its quick commerce service ' Flipkart Minutes ' in select areas of Bengaluru. The new offering promises lightning-fast 8-16 minute deliveries for a diverse range of products, spanning from groceries to electronics.With this move, Flipkart directly challenges established players in the booming quick commerce sector, including Swiggy's Instamart, Zomato's Blinkit , Zepto , and BigBasket's BB Now.The service, which was previously offered on a trial basis to employees at Flipkart's headquarters, is now available to users through the Flipkart app.We confirmed the service's availability by checking an address in HSR on the Flipkart app, which indeed showed Flipkart Minutes as an option for quick delivery. Additionally, several users on X (formerly Twitter) reported that Flipkart is delivering groceries and other items to their addresses in Bengaluru within minutes through the "Minutes" service.Sources familiar with the matter tell the Economic Times that Flipkart plans to expand the service to more areas in Bengaluru over the next few weeks.The launch of Flipkart Minutes comes at a time when other players in the quick commerce space are aggressively expanding their operations.The ET had earlier reported that Flipkart was planning to operate around 100 dark stores to bolster its quick-commerce offerings during the upcoming festive season. Dark stores, which are mini warehouses strategically located for rapid deliveries, have become a crucial component of quick commerce operations.Blinkit, for instance, recently announced ambitious plans to increase its dark store count to 2,000 by 2026. This doubles down on its earlier announced plans to have 1,000 dark stores by March 2025. Similarly, Zepto aims to double its network to 700 dark stores by March 2025. Swiggy Instamart , another major player, currently operates more than 500 such warehouses.Interestingly, Amazon, a key player in the e-commerce space, has not shown interest in the quick-commerce business in India so far. However, it does operate a grocery store service dubbed " Amazon Fresh ," offering same-day delivery for groceries. This is similar to what Flipkart has also been offering through its Grocery tab.
Article Summary: Flipkart has launched its quick commerce service'Flipkart Minutes'in select areas of Bengaluru. The new offering promises lightning-fast 8-16 minute deliveries for a diverse range of products, spanning from groceries to electronics. The service was previously offered on a trial basis to employees at FlipkART's headquarters.

Article Title: California man credits Apple Watch for saving his life: ‘I wouldn’t be here if it wasn’t for this little device’
Article Text:
Apple Watch detects user’s low heart rate



What doctor said

An Apple Watch user is crediting the smartwatch for saving his life after the wearable alerted him about a life-threatening condition. Peter Moore , a resident of Montecito, California shared his experience with a local news publisher KTLA. Narrating the incident, he said “I wouldn’t be here if it wasn’t for this little device”.Moore, who is a former tech executive, said that he was on his way to the airport when he began to feel “a little lightheaded and a little faint”.“Like a typical male, I thought, ‘I’ll go to Starbucks. That’ll fix it,'” Moore explained before he received a notification from the Apple Watch he was wearing.“My phone started to ping and said ‘low heart rate,’ which I’d never seen before. And so I looked at it… my heart rate had dropped to 32. And it was insistent in its notifications that something wasn’t right,” said Moore. He then contacted his wife who took him to hospital.“The doctor kind of theatrically ran in and said, ‘This is not good. This is not good. You need a pacemaker right now,'” Moore said.Omid Yousefian, the cardiac electrophysiologist at Sansum Clinic Cardiology who treated Moore said “Yes, his watch had a big role in saving his life”.“These days, 25% of the population over the age of 40 … have a high chance of experiencing atrial fibrillation,” Yousefian explained.“For us physicians, symptoms are the most important thing. [Moore] was notified by his watch that his heart rate is slow and he correlated that with the symptoms that he had. So he didn’t wait. He didn’t sit. He came to the hospital directly. So he made a very smart move,” Yousefian told the publication.
Article Summary: Peter Moore, a former tech executive, was on his way to the airport when he began to feel “a little lightheaded and a little faint” He received a notification from the Apple Watch he was wearing that his heart rate had dropped to 32. He then contacted his wife who took him to hospital where he was diagnosed with atrial fibrillation.

Article Title: Google launches Pixel Watch 3 in India, comes in two sizes with improved health tracking and more
Article Text: Google has announced its new smartwatch, the Pixel Watch 3 . The new smartwatch comes with significant upgrades over its predecessor, like better performance, improved health tracking, and even a bigger size.The Pixel Watch 3 is crafted from 100% recycled aluminium, and is now available in two sizes –41 mm and 45 mm. Both sizes feature the Actua display, which boasts up to 2000 nits of brightness - twice as bright as the previous model.The watch face has also been enlarged, with over 16% smaller bezels resulting in 10% more screen area on the 41 mm model and 40% more on the 45 mm version.One of the standout features of the Pixel Watch 3 is its advanced running capabilities. Users can now create customised running routines, complete with warm-ups, cooldowns, and interval training. The watch provides real-time guidance through audio and haptic cues, helping runners stay on track with their pace and heart rate targets.Health enthusiasts will appreciate the new readiness and cardio load tracking features. These additions help users balance their workout intensity with recovery time, potentially reducing the risk of overtraining. The watch also introduces the Fitbit Morning Brief , a daily summary of important health and fitness metrics delivered after waking up.Battery life has been improved, with the new model now offering 24 hours of use with the always-on display activated. In Battery Saver mode, it can last up to 36 hours without compromising core health and safety features.The 41mm size of the Pixel Watch is priced at Rs 39,900, while the larger 45mm comes at Rs 42,900. The 41 mm model is available in Matte Black, Polished Silver, and Champagne Gold, while the 45 mm version comes in Matte Black, Polished Silver, and Matte Hazel.Google is offering six months of Fitbit Premium membership with the purchase of a Pixel Watch 3, giving users access to additional insights and personalised recommendations.
Article Summary: The Pixel Watch 3 is crafted from 100% recycled aluminium, and is now available in two sizes –41 mm and 45 mm. Both sizes feature the Actua display, which boasts up to 2000 nits of brightness - twice as bright as the previous model. The 41mm size of the Pixel Watch is priced at Rs 39,900, while the larger 45mm comes at Rs 42,900.

Article Title: iPhone 15 exchange scam on Amazon: Supreme Court lawyer shares how he was 'duped', and what buyers should not do
Article Text:
What exactly happened

Read the complete post here

In a shocking incident, a Supreme Court lawyer, Mukul P Unny , was scammed out of Rs 38,000 while attempting to exchange his iPhone 13 for an iPhone 15 on Amazon .in. The lawyer detailed his ordeal on social media, highlighting the fraudulent tactics employed by the delivery executive.Unny took X (formerly known as Twitter) to post about the new kind of smartphone exchange scam.The incident occurred on July 21, 2024, when Unny placed an order for the iPhone 15 on Amazon. The following day, a delivery executive arrived at his residence and handed over the new phone after receiving the necessary OTP. However, the executive then requested another OTP, claiming it was required to complete the exchange.Despite Unny's hesitation, he was convinced to return the new iPhone to the delivery executive after speaking to the latter's supervisor.Unny contacted Amazon customer care the following day to report the incident. Initially, Amazon assured him of a refund if the product was not delivered. However, subsequent inquiries revealed the case was under investigation with a resolution deadline of July 31.On July 31st, Amazon concluded its investigation and informed Unny that a refund was impossible. The company's explanation lacked substance, as they had not thoroughly verified the scam details. The fact that Unny still possessed his old iPhone directly contradicted Amazon's claim that the exchange was complete.While Amazon has eventually issued a refund to Unny, his ordeal underscores the considerable risks inherent in online transactions, even when dealing with reputable platforms like Amazon.Always verify the identity of a delivery executive before sharing your Amazon OTP. This crucial step can protect you from falling victim to scams.“This is the story of my worst experience with @amazonIN On 21.07.2024, I ordered iPhone 15 from Amazon in exchange for my iPhone 13. On 22.07.2024, the delivery executive came at around 930 PM. I gave the OTP and took the product, and gave my phone to the executive.He said I have give another OTP. I had already given the OTP and was wondering what other OTP is to be given for exchange. I said I dont have any other OTP than the one I have given. He stayed there for few minutes & then called his supervisor.After speaking with the supervisor, the delivery exec asked for return of the product since the "exchange is not final".I insisted that I speak with the supervisor. The supervisor tells me that the exchange is done by a different team & requests for the product to be returned. I said I cannot give away the product especially since the OTP is given and the app was showing that the product is delivered. But this supervisor Ashok (8076650306) requested me to return, lest his team will have to make for the loss.Upon his request and assurance that the product will be "reattempted" the next day, I gave the product to the delivery exec (Vishal 8826421956) after taking the supervisor's and the delivery exec's number. On 23.07.2024, I spoke with the Amazon Customer Care and raised a complaint to which I assured that refund will be initiated if the product is not delivered. Call centre asked me to follow up on 25.07.2024.On 26.07.2024,when I called them, the customer case asked me to wait till 31.05.2024 as "it has to be investigated". Today, when I call Amazon, they said "investigation" is complete and that refund cannot be initiated. No fact-finding was done by Amazon in this. Now, we are staring at a loss of Rs. 38000 and a possible scam done by supervisor, delivery exec and others at Amazon. If they say that the exchange is done, then they can very well see the old phone that I still use with me.This could happen to any one of you and please be aware while dealing with @amazonIN.”
Article Summary: Supreme Court lawyer Mukul P Unny was scammed out of Rs 38,000 while attempting to exchange his iPhone 13 for an iPhone 15 on Amazon.in. The lawyer detailed his ordeal on social media, highlighting the fraudulent tactics employed by the delivery executive. Amazon has eventually issued a refund to Unny.

Article Title: Google Pixel Buds Pro 2 with first Google Tensor AI chip launched: Price in India, specifications and more
Article Text:
Google Pixel Buds Pro 2 price in India, availability

Google Pixel Buds Pro 2 specifications



Google Pixel Buds Pro 2 TWS earphones have been launched in India. Google says that they are designed to be Google’s most comfortable and secure-fitting earbuds. This is the first time that the tech giant is bringing a custom Tensor chip for audio and AI features.Google Pixel Buds Pro 2 TWS earphones price in India is set at Rs 22,900. They will be available in four colours: Porcelain, Hazel, Peony and Wintergreen later this year.Google claims that Pixel Buds Pro 2’s have been designed using 45 million data points from ear scans to come up with the optimal shape for comfort fit.There is a twist-to-adjust stabiliser that can be used to secure the earbuds when exercising.The Pixel Buds Pro 2 come with Tensor A1 chip that, Google claims, have helped reduce size by 27% as well as make them lighter while increasing performance and battery life. The Tensor A1 chip helps in producing advanced audio processing and Google AI. It processes audio 90 times faster than the speed of sound to adapt to the wearer’s environment.There’s Active Noise Cancellation with Silent Seal 2.0 and 11 mm drivers for powerful bass and a new high-frequency chamber for smooth treble. Other features include Clear Calling that is claimed to reduce the noise around the person on the other side of the call.There’s a Conversation Detection feature that uses AI to tell when you start speaking. The music gets paused and the earbuds switch to Transparency mode. When the conversation ends, the music resumes automatically, going back to Active Noise Cancellation.Pixel Buds Pro 2 earphones also support the Find My Device network to find earbuds' precise location on a map. They are claimed to offer up to 8 hours of backup with ANC and additional 30 hours from the case.
Article Summary: Google Pixel Buds Pro 2 TWS earphones have been launched in India. Google says that they are designed to be Google’s most comfortable and secure-fitting earbuds. Price in India is set at Rs 22,900. They will be available in four colours: Porcelain, Hazel, Peony and Wintergreen.
